sen.j: 慈光院（じこういん）は奈良県大和郡山市小泉町にある臨済宗大徳寺派の寺院である。
sen.e: Jiko-in is a Rinzai sect Daitoku-ji school temple located in Koizumi-cho Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture.
Jiko-in Temple is a temple of the Daitoku-ji school of the Rinzai sect located in Koizumi-cho, Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文法を直しました。Jiko-in Templeとしました。
sen.e: Jiko-in Temple is a temple of the Daitoku-ji school of the Rinzai sect located in Koizumi-cho, Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は円通山。
sen.e: Sango (title given to Buddhist temple) is Entsu-zan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the prefixed title given to a Buddhist temple) is Entsu-zan.
sen.cmt: 統一用語を使用しました。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the prefixed title given to a Buddhist temple) is Entsu-zan.

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来。
sen.e: Honzon (principle image of Buddha) is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni).
Its honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni).
Its honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni).

sen.j: 石州流茶道の祖・小泉藩片桐貞昌が創建した。
sen.e: It was built by Sadamasa KATAGIRI of Koizumi province who was the founder of tea ceremony of Sekishu school.
It was built by Sadamasa KATAGIRI of Koizumi Domain who was the founder of tea ceremony of the Sekishu school.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、「小泉藩」を「Koizumi Domain」としました。
sen.e: It was built by Sadamasa KATAGIRI of Koizumi Domain who was the founder of tea ceremony of the Sekishu school.

sen.j: 寛文3年（1663年）に石州流茶道の祖・片桐石見守貞昌（石州）が父・片桐貞隆の菩提寺として大徳寺185世・玉舟和尚（大徹明應禅師）を開山に迎え建立。
sen.e: In 1663, the founder of the tea ceremony of Sekishu school, Sadamasa Iwaminokami KATAGIRI (Sekishu) erected this temple as an ancestral temple of his father, Sadataka KATAGIRI and had Gyokushu Osho (大徹明應禅師), 185th of Daitoku-ji Temple as the head monk.

In 1663, Sadamasa Iwaminokami KATAGIRI (Sekishu), the founder of tea ceremony of the Sekishu school, erected this temple as an ancestral temple of his father, Sadataka KATAGIRI, and had Priest Gyokushu (大徹明應禅師), the 185th head of Daitoku-ji Temple, as the head priest.
sen.cmt: 文法を直しました。和尚はPriestとしました。
sen.e: In 1663, Sadamasa Iwaminokami KATAGIRI (Sekishu), the founder of tea ceremony of the Sekishu school, erected this temple as an ancestral temple of his father, Sadataka KATAGIRI, and had Priest Gyokushu (大徹明應禅師), the 185th head of Daitoku-ji Temple, as the head priest.

sen.j: 慈光院の名は父・貞隆の法名「慈光院殿雪庭宗立居士」から採られた。
sen.e: The name Jiko-in was taken from his father, Sadataka's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood), '慈光院殿雪庭宗立居士.'
The name Jiko-in was taken from his father, Sadataka's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood), '慈光院殿雪庭宗立居士.'
The name Jiko-in was taken from his father, Sadataka's homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood), '慈光院殿雪庭宗立居士.'

sen.j: 書院（重要文化財）
sen.e: Shoin (reception room) (Important cultural property)
Shoin (reception room) (an important cultural property)
Shoin (reception room) (an important cultural property)

sen.j: 農家風の外観をもつ慈光院の中心的な建物。
sen.e: One of the main building of Jiko-in Temple with the exterior appearance of farm house.
It is one of the main buildings of Jiko-in Temple with the exterior appearance of a farm house.
sen.cmt: 主語を加え文としました。冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: It is one of the main buildings of Jiko-in Temple with the exterior appearance of a farm house.

sen.j: 入母屋造茅葺屋根に桟瓦の庇をめぐらし、十三畳の上の間と、中の間、下の間からなる。
sen.e: Irimoya Zukuri Kayabuki Yane (The thatched roof of the Irimoya style) with pan-tiled eaves, and it has upper room of 13 tatami mats, and middle room and bottom room.

It has a type of roof called Irimoya Zukuri Kayabuki Yane (the thatched roof of the Irimoya style) surrounded by eaves made with pantiles, an 13-tatami-mat upper room, a middle room, and a lower room.
sen.cmt: 文法を直しました。主語を補い一文にしました。
sen.e: It has a type of roof called Irimoya Zukuri Kayabuki Yane (the thatched roof of the Irimoya style) surrounded by eaves made with pantiles, an 13-tatami-mat upper room, a middle room, and a lower room.

sen.j: 上の間には床・付書院を備えているものの、長押は省かれ、簡素で軽やかな意匠である。
sen.e: Although floor and tsukeshoin (a built-in table) are prepared in the upper room, nageshi (a horizontal piece of timber) is taken out, which makes the design very simple with light image.
Although the floor and tsuke-shoin (a built-in table) are prepared in the upper room, it does not have a nageshi (a horizontal piece of timber) and presents a simple and light image.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を補足、及び表現を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Although the floor and tsuke-shoin (a built-in table) are prepared in the upper room, it does not have a nageshi (a horizontal piece of timber) and presents a simple and light image.

sen.j: また全体に天井や鴨居の高さを低くしており、座ったときに安らぎや落ち着きが出るよう熟慮されている。
sen.e: Also, the height of overall ceiling and kamoi (a generic term for a head jamb, normally have tracks for sliding doors or partitions) are made lower, and careful consideration is made to bring out calmness and peacefulness when sitting down in this room.

Also, the ceiling and kamoi (a generic term for a head jamb, which normally has tracks for sliding doors or partitions) are set low on average out of adequate consideration so that one can feel relaxed or calm when sitting down in this room.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を補足、他、文法、表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Also, the ceiling and kamoi (a generic term for a head jamb, which normally has tracks for sliding doors or partitions) are set low on average out of adequate consideration so that one can feel relaxed or calm when sitting down in this room.

sen.j: 奈良盆地の眺望が素晴らしいことでも名高い。
sen.e: It is famous for the beautiful scenery of Nara basin.
It is famous for the beautiful scenery of the Nara Basin.
sen.cmt: 奈良盆地をthe Nara Basinとしました。
sen.e: It is famous for the beautiful scenery of the Nara Basin.

sen.j: 北側には三畳逆勝手の閑茶室がある。
sen.e: In the northern side there is a tea room of 3 tatami mats and left-handed use.
In the north there is a small tea room of 3 tatami mats made in the Gyakugatte style (in which a guest sits at the left of a host in a tea ceremony).
sen.cmt: 「逆勝手」を「客が主人の左手に座るかたちの～」としました（デジタル大辞泉より）。
sen.e: In the north there is a small tea room of 3 tatami mats made in the Gyakugatte style (in which a guest sits at the left of a host in a tea ceremony).

sen.j: 茶室（高林庵）（重要文化財）
sen.e: Tea room (Korinan) (Important cultural property)
Tea room (Korinan) (an important cultural property)
Tea room (Korinan) (an important cultural property)

sen.j: 片桐石州好みの二畳台目の席。
sen.e: Two and three-quarters tatami mats size of room in tea room, favored by Sekishu KATAGIRI.
It is a tea room of 2.75 tatami mat size, which was the kind favored by Sekishu KATAGIRI.
sen.cmt: 主語を追加し一文としました。
sen.e: It is a tea room of 2.75 tatami mat size, which was the kind favored by Sekishu KATAGIRI.

sen.j: 床（とこ）前を点前座とした亭主床の構えをとる。
sen.e: It is structured like Teishudoko (host's alcove) where the alcove front is at the corner of the hearth.
It is structured after the Teishu-doko (a host's alcove) style in which the front of an alcove is set as the seat for a host in a tea-ceremony room.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明のため、点前座をthe seat for a host in a tea-ceremony roomとし、床前はthe front of an alcoveとしました。
sen.e: It is structured after the Teishu-doko (a host's alcove) style in which the front of an alcove is set as the seat for a host in a tea-ceremony room.

sen.j: 茨木門
sen.e: Ibaraki-mon gate
Ibaraki-mon Gate
Ibaraki-mon Gate

sen.j: 徳川家康の発した一国一城令により取り壊された片桐石州の出生地でもある茨木城の楼門をもらい受けたものである。
sen.e: It is the Romon (two-storied gate) of Ibaraki-jo Castle which is the birth place of Sekishu KATAGIRI, and he received this when it was taken down due to Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) ordered by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and by putting together the roof and Shoin, then thatching a roof with grass and reroofing, it became the Sammon gate (temple gate) of Jiko-in Temple.

It was originally the romon (two-storied gate) of Ibaraki-jo Castle where Sekishu KATAGIRI was born and was received by him when the castle was taken down due to Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) ordered by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。代名詞を少なくし分かりやすくしました。山門にはsanmonの綴りを採用しました。時制を変更しました。
sen.e: It was originally the romon (two-storied gate) of Ibaraki-jo Castle where Sekishu KATAGIRI was born and was received by him when the castle was taken down due to Ikkoku Ichijo Rei (Law of One Castle per Province) ordered by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 屋根を書院と合わせて茅葺きに葺き替えて慈光院の山門とされた。
sen.e: Then, in order to match its roof with that of Shoin, it was re-roofed with thatch and finally became the sammon gate (a temple gate) of Jiko-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。日本語の解釈は、「門の屋根と書院をマッチさせるために」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Then, in order to match its roof with that of Shoin, it was re-roofed with thatch and finally became the sanmon gate (a temple gate) of Jiko-in Temple.

sen.j: 庭園（名勝・史跡）
sen.e: Garden (places of scenic beauty and historic sites)
Garden (places of scenic beauty and historic sites)
Garden (places of scenic beauty and historic sites)

sen.j: 白砂の中にツツジなどの大刈込があり、その向こうには奈良盆地が広がる。
sen.e: Within the white sand, there are large pruning such as azalea, and beyond that spreads the basin of Nara.
There are beautifully trimmed large shrubberies made of azalea or other shrubs and beyond that the Nara Basin spreads out.
sen.cmt: 「大刈り込み」は「多数の樹木を寄せて植え、一つの大きな形となるように刈り込んだもの」（三省堂大辞林より）。Pruningだと違う意味になると思います。
sen.e: There are beautifully trimmed large shrubberies made of azalea or other shrubs and beyond that the Nara Basin spreads out.

sen.j: 書院 附：手水鉢3箇（独坐の手水鉢、角ばらずの手水鉢、女（め）の字の手水鉢）
sen.e: Shoin attachment: 3 chozubachi (a basin for water to purify before entering shrine) (Dokuza chozubachi, chozubachi without corners, chozubachi shaped like the kanji for girl)

Shoin attachments: 3 chozubachies (a basin for water to purify before entering shrine) (Dokuza no Chozubachi [a chozubachi which sits alone], Kakubarazu no Chozubachi [a chozubachi without corners], and Menoji no Chozubachi [a chozubachi shaped like the kanji for girl])
sen.cmt: 複数形に(attachments)しました。及び説明を補足しました。
sen.e: Shoin attachments: 3 chozubachies (a basin for water to purify before entering shrine) (Dokuza no Chozubachi [a chozubachi which sits alone], Kakubarazu no Chozubachi [a chozubachi without corners], and Menoji no Chozubachi [a chozubachi shaped like the kanji for girl])

sen.j: 茶室 附：蹲踞（つくばい）1箇
sen.e: Tea room attachment: 1 tsukubai (a stone washbasin)
Tea room attachments: 1 tsukubai (a stone washbasin)
Tea room attachments: 1 tsukubai (a stone washbasin)

sen.j: 片桐石州像
sen.e: Statue of Sekishu KATAGIRI
Statue of Sekishu KATAGIRI
Statue of Sekishu KATAGIRI

sen.j: 石州が自分のために大徳寺の中に建てた「高林庵」にまつった34歳の時の自作の像である。
sen.e: It is Sekishu's statue that he made of himself when he was 34, that he placed in 'Korinan' inside the Daikoku-ji Temple which he built for himself, and after Korinan was abandoned due to Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism), it was transferred to Jiko-in Temple.
It is a statue of Sekishu made by Sekishu himself when he was 34, which was originally placed in 'Korin-an,' a hermitage Sekishu had built for himself in the Daitoku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。文法、スペルミスあり(Daitokuji)、直しました。
sen.e: It is a statue of Sekishu made by Sekishu himself when he was 34, which was originally placed in 'Korin-an,' a hermitage Sekishu had built for himself in the Daitoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 廃仏毀釈で高林庵が廃寺になったため、慈光院に移された。
sen.e: After Korin-an was abandoned due to Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism), it was transferred to Jiko-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: After Korin-an was abandoned due to Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism), it was transferred to Jiko-in Temple.

sen.j: 拝観時間：午前9時～午後5時（年中無休）
sen.e: Visit hours: 9AM to 5PM (open 7 days a week)
Visit hours: 9AM to 5PM (open 7 days a week)
Visit hours: 9AM to 5PM (open 7 days a week)

sen.j: 拝観料：1,000円
sen.e: Entrance fee: 1000 yen
Entrance fee: 1000 yen
Entrance fee: 1000 yen

sen.e: Access by train
Access by train
Access by train

sen.j: JR 大和路線 大和小泉駅 下車 → 徒歩15分
sen.e: JR Yamatoji line to Yamato Koizumi Station =>15 minute walk
JR Yamatoji line to Yamato Koizumi Station =>15 minute walk
JR Yamatoji line to Yamato Koizumi Station =>15 minute walk

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道 近鉄橿原線 近鉄郡山駅 → 奈良交通 「慈光院」 下車
sen.e: Kinki Nippon Railway Kintetsu Kashihara line to Kintetsu Koriyama Station => Get off at Nara Kotsu 'Jiko-in'
Kinki Nippon Railway Kintetsu Kashihara line to Kintetsu Koriyama Station => Get off at Nara Kotsu 'Jiko-in'
Kinki Nippon Railway Kintetsu Kashihara line to Kintetsu Koriyama Station => Get off at Nara Kotsu 'Jiko-in'

sen.e: Access by car
Access by car
Access by car

sen.j: 西名阪自動車道 法隆寺インターチェンジ → 奈良県道5号大和高田斑鳩線 → 国道25号 → 奈良県道9号
sen.e: Nishi Meihan Jidosha-do Horyu-ji interchange => Nara Kendo 5 Yamato Takada Karuga-sen => Koku-do (Route) 25 => Nara Kendo 9
Nishi Meihan Jidosha-do Horyu-ji interchange => Nara Kendo 5 Yamato Takada Karuga-sen => Koku-do (Route) 25 => Nara Kendo 9
Nishi Meihan Jidosha-do Horyu-ji interchange => Nara Kendo 5 Yamato Takada Karuga-sen => Koku-do (Route) 25 => Nara Kendo 9
